00032 //! \brief Base class for MatrixReadOperators.
00033 //! \author Lee Netherton
00034 //!
00035 //! A MatrixReadOperator is a class which will perform a read operation on a
00036 //! matrix. The MatrixReadOperator class is never instantiated directly, but
00037 //! serves as a base for derived operator classes. It provides basic read operatons
00038 //! for its derivatives.
00039 //!
00040 class MatrixReadOperator
00041 {
00042         protected:
00043 
00044                 //! Pointer to owner matrix
00045                 MatrixAliasConstant * m_thisMatrix;
00046 
00047 
00048         public:
00049 
00050                 //! \brief Default Constructor
00051                 //!
00052                 //! Creates an empty operator class which can then be more full constructed
00053                 //! using _constructMatrixReadOperator()
00054                 MatrixReadOperator() {}
00055 
00056                 //! \brief Full Constructor
00057                 //!
00058                 //! Creates an operator class which takes and stores a pointer to an owner matrix
00059                 //! \param matrixAliasConstant Pointer to owner matrix
00060                 MatrixReadOperator(MatrixAliasConstant * matrixAliasConstant) : m_thisMatrix(matrixAliasConstant) {}
00061 
00062                 //! \brief Manual Constructor
00063                 //!
00064                 //! Constructs the class manually by setting the owner pointer
00065                 //! \param matrixAliasConstant Pointer to owner matrix
00066                 void _constructMatrixReadOperator(MatrixAliasConstant * matrixAliasConstant) {m_thisMatrix = matrixAliasConstant;}
00067 
00068                 //! Returns the number of rows the matrix has
00069                 const unsigned int getRows() const;
00070 
00071                 //! Returns the number of columns the matrix has
00072                 const unsigned int getColumns() const;
00073 
00074                 //! Returns the a pointer to the matrix data array
00075                 const double * getDataPointer() const;
00076 
00077                 //! Returns a read-only reference to the data member at specified position
00078                 //! \param row Row position of desired element (zero indexed)
00079                 //! \param column Column position of desired element (zero indexed)
00080                 const double& element(const unsigned int row, const unsigned int column) const;
00081 
00082                 //! Returns a read-only reference to the data member at specified position
00083                 //! \param index Row-wise position of element (zero-indexed)
00084                 const double& element(const unsigned int index) const;
00085 
00086                 //! For flagging errors - to be depreciated.
00087                 void error(const char* str) const;
00088 
00089 };
00090 
00091 
00092 //! \brief Base class for MatrixWriteOperators.
00093 //! \author Lee Netherton
00094 //!
00095 //! A MatrixWriteOperator is a class which will perform a write operation on a
00096 //! matrix. The MatrixWriteOperator class is never instantiated directly, but
00097 //! serves as a base for derived operator classes. It provides basic write operatons
00098 //! for its derivatives.
00099 //!
00100 class MatrixWriteOperator
00101 {
00102         protected:
00103 
00104                 //! Pointer to owner matrix
00105                 MatrixAlias * m_thisMatrix;
00106 
00107         public:
00108 
00109                 //! \brief Default Constructor
00110                 //!
00111                 //! Creates an empty operator class which can then be more full constructed
00112                 //! using _constructMatrixWriteOperator()
00113                 MatrixWriteOperator() {}
00114 
00115                 //! \brief Full Constructor
00116                 //!
00117                 //! Creates an operator class which takes and stores a pointer to an owner matrix
00118                 //! \param matrixAlias Pointer to owner matrix
00119                 MatrixWriteOperator(MatrixAlias * matrixAlias) : m_thisMatrix(matrixAlias) {}
00120 
00121                 //! \brief Manual Constructor
00122                 //!
00123                 //! Constructs the class manually by setting the owner pointer
00124                 //! \param matrixAlias Pointer to owner matrix
00125                 void _constructMatrixWriteOperator(MatrixAlias * matrixAlias) {m_thisMatrix = matrixAlias;}
00126 
00127                 //! Returns the number of rows the matrix has
00128                 const unsigned int getRows() const;
00129 
00130                 //! Returns the number of columns the matrix has
00131                 const unsigned int getColumns() const;
00132 
00133                 //! Returns the a pointer to the matrix data array
00134                 double * getDataPointer() const;
00135 
00136                 //! \brief Sets the data pointer
00137                 void setDataPointer(double * data) const;
00138 
00139                 //! \brief Sets the number of rows
00140                 void setRows(const unsigned int num) const;
00141 
00142                 //! \brief Sets the number of columns
00143                 void setColumns(const unsigned int num) const;
00144 
00145                 //! Returns a writable reference to the data member at specified position
00146                 //! \param row Row position of desired element (zero indexed)
00147                 //! \param column Column position of desired element (zero indexed)
00148                 double& element(const unsigned int row, const unsigned int column) const;
00149 
00150                 //! Returns a writable reference to the data member at specified position
00151                 //! \param index Row-wise position of element (zero-indexed)
00152                 double& element(const unsigned int index) const;
00153 
00154                 //! For flagging errors - to be depreciated.
00155                 void error(const char* str) const;
00156 
00157 };

00159 //! \brief Base class for SquareMatrixReadOperators.
00160 //! \author Lee Netherton
00161 //!
00162 //! Most importantly provides m_thisMatrix with the right
00163 //! kind of pointer.
00164 //!
00165 class SquareMatrixReadOperator : public MatrixReadOperator
00166 {
00167         protected:
00168 
00169                 //! Pointer to owner matrix
00170                 SquareMatrixAliasConstant * m_thisMatrix;
00171 
00172         public:
00173                 //! \brief Default Constructor
00174                 //!
00175                 //! Creates an empty operator class which can then be more full constructed
00176                 //! using _constructSquareMatrixReadOperator()
00177                 SquareMatrixReadOperator() {}
00178 
00179                 //! \brief Full Constructor
00180                 //!
00181                 //! Creates an operator class which takes and stores a pointer to an owner matrix
00182                 //! \param squareMatrixAliasConstant Pointer to owner matrix
00183                 SquareMatrixReadOperator(SquareMatrixAliasConstant * squareMatrixAliasConstant) :
00184                         MatrixReadOperator((MatrixAliasConstant *)squareMatrixAliasConstant),
00185                         m_thisMatrix(squareMatrixAliasConstant)
00186                         {}
00187 
00188                 //! \brief Manual Constructor
00189                 //!
00190                 //! Constructs the class manually by setting the owner pointer
00191                 //! \param squareMatrixAliasConstant Pointer to owner matrix
00192                 void _constructSquareMatrixReadOperator(SquareMatrixAliasConstant * squareMatrixAliasConstant)
00193                 {
00194                         _constructMatrixReadOperator((MatrixAliasConstant *)squareMatrixAliasConstant);
00195 
00196                         m_thisMatrix = squareMatrixAliasConstant;
00197                 }
00198 };

00409 //! \brief Read matrix element.
00410 //! \author Lee Netherton
00411 //!
00412 class MRO_Element : public MatrixReadOperator
00413 {
00414         public:
00415                 //! \brief Read element given row, column position
00416                 //! \param row Row position (zero-indexed)
00417                 //! \param column Column position (zero-indexed)
00418                 const double& operator()(const unsigned int row, const unsigned int column) const {return element(row,column);}
00419 
00420                 //! \brief Read element given row-wise index position
00421                 //! \param index Index of element (zero-indexed)
00422                 const double& operator()(const unsigned int index) const {return element(index);}
00423 
00424 };
00425

00708                 //!

00765                 //! \param columns Desired number of columns

00767

00770 //! \brief Resize matrix (allocate new memory if number of elements changes).
00771 //! \author Lee Netherton
00772 //!
00773 class MWO_Resize : public MatrixWriteOperator
00774 {
00775         public:
00776                 //! \brief Resize matrix (allocate new memory if number of elements changes)
00777                 //! \param rows Desired number of rows
00778                 //! \param columns Desired number of columns
00779                 void operator()(const unsigned int rows, const unsigned int columns) const;
00780 
00781 };
00782

00784 //! \author Lee Netherton and Peter Mendham
00785 //!
00786 class MWO_Zero : public MatrixWriteOperator
00787 {
00788         public:
00789                 //! \brief Make all the elements in this matrix equal zero
00790                 void operator()() const;
00791 
00792 };

00803 
00804                 //! \brief Make all the elements in this matrix equal unity
00805                 void operator()() const;
00806 
00807 };
